name: Born This Way Soft Blur Flexible Finish Setting Powder
about: What it is:A non-comedogenic, silky-smooth powder that sets, blots, and touches-up makeupu2014the lightweight formula blurs pores for a flawless soft-focus finish..Coverage:Light.Finish:Matte.Formulation:Pressed Powder.Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens and mineral oil. It is also vegan and cruelty-free..What Else You Need to Know:This oil absorbing formula offers a light, smooth, cloud-like feel.
ingredients: Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Silica, Zinc Stearate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Dimethicone, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Mica, Sodium Hyaluronate, Rhododendron Ferrugineum Extract, Dimethicone/Vinyl Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Ethylhexyl Palmitate, Trihydroxystearin, Diisostearyl Malate, Potassium Sorbate, Dehydroacetic Acid, [+/- Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Iron Oxides (CI 77499), Zinc Oxide (CI 77947)]. ..Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up to date list of ingredients.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Swirl brush in powder..-Sweep onto skin or use a sponge or pad to gently press powder onto high-shine areas as needed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This powder is actually good! A lot of times I have trouble finding a good powder, since the powders Iu2019ve tried were pretty dry or I just saw no results. This powder is actually so good at giving a semi-matte appearance and itu2019s perfect. For reference, I have oily and acne prone skin. This also doesnu2019t break me out, which is surprising since I break out very easily and need to be very careful. I would repurchase! I donu2019t know how long that would take though, since the powder has a lot of product!

reviews.review_text: I switched to this powder becaues I realized that my drugstore powder had a lot of pore clogging ingredients. This one is WAY cleaner and better for my skin. For $54 this compact should be WAY bigger. I have had this powder for a little over a week and I have already hit pan. Now, I do use powder as my primary foundation because i'm very oily so I don't wear regular foundation, so I do use a decent amount of product. But still - I think for this price tag there should be no reason I have hit pan already. My drug store powder would last me 2-3 months at least. I want to continue using this but I don't know if I can justify the price.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have a lot to say about this powder. The fact that itu2019s vegan and cruelty free is a huge plus for me. I also really appreciate that itu2019s non comedogenic, and doesnu2019t break out my sensitive, acne prone skin.  One of the things I like most about this powder is how lightweight it feels. Even when I layer it on top of my foundation and concealer, it never looks cakey. Itu2019s perfect for mattifying the T zone, but I do find that I need to touch up every few hours. I have larger pores, and while I didnu2019t notice a magically dramatic difference, I did see a slight blurring effect on my cheeks.  I have a big issue with the shade range. Four shades just arenu2019t inclusive enough, and I feel like brands should really know better by now. Thereu2019s no excuse for not offering a wider range of shades to suit all skin tones. Itu2019s disappointing because the product itself is great, but the limited shade range makes it less accessible.  If you can find a shade that works for you, I think this setting powder is worth a try, especially if youu2019re looking for a setting powder thatu2019s gentle on sensitive, acne prone skin. But the shade range could use improvement.

Plus the fact that they only offer four shades for this product. In this day and age for a brand to be more inclusive, they need to offer more shades in my opinion.

It helps to subtly blur imperfections, giving my skin a smoother, more polished look without being too matte or too dewy. Plus, the fact that itu2019s flexible means it doesnu2019t settle into fine lines or emphasize dry patches, which is a huge win for me.  Overall, the Born This Way Soft Blur Setting Powder has become a staple in my makeup routine. It gives me that perfect finish every time, and I can trust it to keep my makeup in place all day long.

reviews.review_text: Excuse me, stop right nowu2014this packaging is stunning! I am genuinely captivated by its beauty. The Too Faced Born This Way Soft Blur Setting Powder serves multiple purposes, including setting, blotting, and touching up makeup. Its silky-smooth texture ensures effortless application, effectively concealing oily shine without feeling heavy. My heart couldn't help but flutter upon discovering this creamy powder formula that imparts a soft-focus finish, remarkable for its weightlessness. I opted for the Medium shade. This product undoubtedly stands out for individuals seeking a flawless complexion. The setting powder creates a gentle, natural blurring effect, skillfully smoothing out imperfections without appearing cakey or heavy. Its lightweight composition guarantees comfortable wear throughout the day, while its exceptional ability to control shine makes it an ideal choice for those with oily or combination skin. This pressed powder not only does that alone, but it is also full coverage. I didn't notice any scent, but overall, I love it.

I set my face and makeup with this powder with a fluffy brush which has helped my makeup to stay on all day. The gold heart packaging is so beautiful as well!

reviews.review_text: Upon opening the product, I noticed that the packaging is not thick or bulky despite having a hard case which would make it super easy to throw into my bag on the go without it taking up too much space. The powder itself is scent less which I appreciate, and the texture is as advertised - soft, silky with a buttery feel that easily glides over the skin. No powder is able to hide extreme texture but this one does a pretty good job of blurring out any tiny blemishes. Overall, this is a great little compact face powder to have in my collection!
